source.agency: NOAA Climate Program Office; NOAA Ocean Acidification Program

oads_metadata.supplementalInfo: Port of Call: Newport, RI Experiment Type: Research Cruise Cruise Info: AOML_SOOP_OA The analytical system operated fine during this cruise. The SBE38 SST sensor was replaced at the start of this field season, and for an undetermined reason, the measured SST values were not reliable. The data from one of the ship's through hull sensors (MidSea at 3 meters) was used for SST values. A bracketing 1-minute average of this sensor showed smooth, reliable behavior and was used for processing. For 70 minutes starting at 13:40 on 11 March, the through-hull SST sensors were not recorded. For this interval, SST was estimated from the equilibrator temperature. Original Data Location: http://www.aoml.noaa.gov/ocd/ocdweb/bigelow/bigelow_introduction.html . Full unprocessed data files from analytical instrument including flow information plus meteorological and TSG data at time of sampling can be obtained upon request.

variable.name: xCO2_EQU_ppm
variable.fullName: Mole fraction of CO2 in the equilibrator headspace (dry) at equilibrator temperature (ppm)
variable.methodReference: Pierrot, D., C. Neil, K. Sullivan, R. Castle, R. Wanninkhof, H. Lueger, T. Johannessen, A. Olsen, R. A. Feely, and C. E. Cosca (2009), Recommendations for autonomous underway pCO2 measuring systems and data reduction routines, Deep-Sea Res II, 56, 512-522.
variable.samplingInstrument: Equilibrator: Primary equilibrator is vented through a secondary equilibrator.
variable.analyzingInstrument: CO2 Sensor: Manufacturer: LI-COR; Model: 6262; Calibration: The analyzer is calibrated every 3.5 hours with field standards that in turn were calibrated with primary standards that are directly traceable to the WMO X2019 scale. The zero gas is ultra-high purity air.; Number of non-zero gases: 4; Measured CO2 Parameters: xco2(dry); Instrument is located in an air-conditioned laboratory. Ultra-High Purity air (0.0 ppm CO2) and the high standard gas are used to zero and span the LI-COR analyzer.
variable.detailedAnalyzingInfo: Resolution/Precision: 0.01 ppm Frequency: Every 140 seconds, except during calibration Details of CO2 Sensing: details of CO2 sensing (not required)

standardization.description: The analyzer is calibrated every 3.5 hours with field standards that in turn were calibrated with primary standards that are directly traceable to the WMO X2019 scale. The zero gas is ultra-high purity air.
standardization.frequency: calibration gas 1: used every ~4.5 hours., calibration gas 2: used every ~4.5 hours., calibration gas 3: used every ~4.5 hours., calibration gas 4: used every ~4.5 hours., calibration gas 5: used every ~23.5 hours.

equilibrator.type: Spray head above dynamic pool with thermal jacket
equilibrator.volume: 0.95 L; Water Volume: 0.4 L; Gas Volume: 0.55 L

temperatureMeasurement.method: Equilibrator Temperature Sensor: Manufacturer: Hart; Model: 1523; Calibration: Factory calibration; Resolution is taken as Precision.

pressureMeasurement.method: Equilibrator Pressure Sensor: Manufacturer: Setra; Model: 270; Calibration: Factory calibration; Manufacturer's Resolution is taken as Precision.

variable.co2GasDryingMethod: Gas stream passes through a thermoelectric condenser (~5 °C) and then through a Perma Pure (Nafion) dryer before reaching the analyzer (90% dry).

variable.name: xCO2_ATM_ppm
variable.fullName: Mole fraction of CO2 measured in dry outside air (ppm)
variable.methodReference: Pierrot, D., C. Neil, K. Sullivan, R. Castle, R. Wanninkhof, H. Lueger, T. Johannessen, A. Olsen, R. A. Feely, and C. E. Cosca (2009), Recommendations for autonomous underway pCO2 measuring systems and data reduction routines, Deep-Sea Res II, 56, 512-522.
variable.analyzingInstrument: CO2 Sensor: Manufacturer: LI-COR; Model: 6262; Calibration: The analyzer is calibrated every 3.5 hours with field standards that in turn were calibrated with primary standards that are directly traceable to the WMO X2019 scale. The zero gas is ultra-high purity air.; Number of non-zero gases: 4; Measured CO2 Parameters: xco2(dry); Instrument is located in an air-conditioned laboratory. Ultra-High Purity air (0.0 ppm CO2) and the high standard gas are used to zero and span the LI-COR analyzer.
variable.detailedAnalyzingInfo: Drying Method: Gas stream passes through a thermoelectric condenser (~5 °C) and then through a Perma Pure (Nafion) dryer before reaching the analyzer (90% dry). Sampling location: Mast above the bridge, ~18 meters above sea surface Resolution/Precision: 0.01 ppm Details of CO2 Sensing: details of CO2 sensing (not required) Measurement: Yes, 5 readings in a group every 3.5 hours

variable.name: xCO2_ATM_interpolated_ppm
variable.fullName: Mole fraction of CO2 in outside air associated with each water analysis. These values are interpolated between the bracketing averaged good xCO2_ATM analyses (ppm)
variable.methodReference: Pierrot, D., C. Neil, K. Sullivan, R. Castle, R. Wanninkhof, H. Lueger, T. Johannessen, A. Olsen, R. A. Feely, and C. E. Cosca (2009), Recommendations for autonomous underway pCO2 measuring systems and data reduction routines, Deep-Sea Res II, 56, 512-522.
variable.analyzingInstrument: CO2 Sensor: Manufacturer: LI-COR; Model: 6262; Calibration: The analyzer is calibrated every 3.5 hours with field standards that in turn were calibrated with primary standards that are directly traceable to the WMO X2019 scale. The zero gas is ultra-high purity air.; Number of non-zero gases: 4; Measured CO2 Parameters: xco2(dry); Instrument is located in an air-conditioned laboratory. Ultra-High Purity air (0.0 ppm CO2) and the high standard gas are used to zero and span the LI-COR analyzer.
variable.detailedAnalyzingInfo: Drying Method: Gas stream passes through a thermoelectric condenser (~5 °C) and then through a Perma Pure (Nafion) dryer before reaching the analyzer (90% dry). Sampling location: Mast above the bridge, ~18 meters above sea surface Resolution/Precision: 0.01 ppm Details of CO2 Sensing: details of CO2 sensing (not required) Measurement: Yes, 5 readings in a group every 3.5 hours

variable.name: fCO2_SW@SST_uatm
variable.fullName: Fugacity of CO2 in sea water at SST and 100% humidity (μatm)
variable.methodReference: Pierrot, D., C. Neil, K. Sullivan, R. Castle, R. Wanninkhof, H. Lueger, T. Johannessen, A. Olsen, R. A. Feely, and C. E. Cosca (2009), Recommendations for autonomous underway pCO2 measuring systems and data reduction routines, Deep-Sea Res II, 56, 512-522.

The zero gas is ultra-high purity air.; Number of non-zero gases: 4; Measured CO2 Parameters: xco2(dry); Instrument is located in an air-conditioned laboratory. Ultra-High Purity air (0.0 ppm CO2) and the high standard gas are used to zero and span the LI-COR analyzer.
variable.detailedAnalyzingInfo: Resolution/Precision: 0.01 μatm Frequency: Every 140 seconds, except during calibration Details of CO2 Sensing: details of CO2 sensing (not required)

standardization.frequency: calibration gas 1: used every ~4.5 hours., calibration gas 2: used every ~4.5 hours., calibration gas 3: used every ~4.5 hours., calibration gas 4: used every ~4.5 hours., calibration gas 5: used every ~23.5 hours.

equilibrator.type: Spray head above dynamic pool with thermal jacket
equilibrator.volume: 0.95 L; Water Volume: 0.4 L; Gas Volume: 0.55 L

temperatureMeasurement.method: Equilibrator Temperature Sensor: Manufacturer: Hart; Model: 1523; Calibration: Factory calibration; Resolution is taken as Precision.

pressureMeasurement.method: Equilibrator Pressure Sensor: Manufacturer: Setra; Model: 270; Calibration: Factory calibration; Manufacturer's Resolution is taken as Precision.

variable.co2GasDryingMethod: Gas stream passes through a thermoelectric condenser (~5 °C) and then through a Perma Pure (Nafion) dryer before reaching the analyzer (90% dry).

variable.name: fCO2_ATM_interpolated_uatm
variable.fullName: Fugacity of CO2 in air corresponding to the interpolated xCO2 at SST and 100% humidity (μatm)
variable.methodReference: Pierrot, D., C. Neil, K. Sullivan, R. Castle, R. Wanninkhof, H. Lueger, T. Johannessen, A. Olsen, R. A. Feely, and C. E. Cosca (2009), Recommendations for autonomous underway pCO2 measuring systems and data reduction routines, Deep-Sea Res II, 56, 512-522.

The zero gas is ultra-high purity air.; Number of non-zero gases: 4; Measured CO2 Parameters: xco2(dry); Instrument is located in an air-conditioned laboratory. Ultra-High Purity air (0.0 ppm CO2) and the high standard gas are used to zero and span the LI-COR analyzer.
variable.detailedAnalyzingInfo: Drying Method: Gas stream passes through a thermoelectric condenser (~5 °C) and then through a Perma Pure (Nafion) dryer before reaching the analyzer (90% dry). Sampling location: Mast above the bridge, ~18 meters above sea surface Resolution/Precision: 0.01 μatm Details of CO2 Sensing: details of CO2 sensing (not required) Measurement: Yes, 5 readings in a group every 3.5 hours

variable.name: PRES_EQU_hPa
variable.fullName: Barometric pressure in the equilibrator headspace (hPa)
variable.analyzingInstrument: Equilibrator Pressure Sensor: Manufacturer: Setra; Model: 270; Calibration: Factory calibration; Manufacturer's Resolution is taken as Precision.
variable.detailedAnalyzingInfo: Pressure Correction: Normalized: yes Sampling location: Attached to equilibrator headspace. Differential pressure reading from Setra 239 attached to the equilibrator headspace is added to the pressure reading from the LICOR, which is measured by an external Setra 270 connected to the exit of the analyzer. Resolution/Precision: 0.015 hPa

variable.name: PRES_ATM@SSP_hPa
variable.fullName: Barometric pressure measured outside, corrected to sea level (hPa)
variable.analyzingInstrument: Atmospheric Pressure Sensor: Manufacturer: Vaisala; Model: PTB220; Calibration: Factory calibration; Manufacturer's Resolution is taken as Precision; Maintained by ship.
variable.detailedAnalyzingInfo: Pressure Correction: Normalized: yes Sampling location: On mast above the bridge at ~18 m above sea surface water Resolution/Precision: 0.01 hPa

variable.name: TEMP_EQU_C
variable.analyzingInstrument: Equilibrator Temperature Sensor: Manufacturer: Hart; Model: 1523; Calibration: Factory calibration; Resolution is taken as Precision.
variable.detailedAnalyzingInfo: Sampling location: Inserted into equilibrator ~5 cm below water level Resolution/Precision: 0.0003 deg C

variable.name: SST_C
variable.analyzingInstrument: Water Temperature Sensor: Manufacturer: AirMar; Model: B17-S-Temp; Calibration: Factory calibration; Manufacturer's Resolution is taken as Precision; 'MidSea' Sensor, maintained by the ship.
variable.detailedAnalyzingInfo: Sampling location: Through starboard hull at 3 meters depth Resolution/Precision: 0.01 deg C

variable.name: SAL_permil
variable.fullName: Sea surface salinity on Practical Salinity Scale (o/oo)
variable.analyzingInstrument: Salinity Sensor: Manufacturer: Seabird; Model: SBE 45; Calibration: Factory calibration; Manufacturer's Resolution is taken as Precision; Maintained by the ship.
variable.detailedAnalyzingInfo: Sampling location: In dry lab after a debubbler, next to CO2 system Resolution/Precision: 0.0002 ppt

variable.name: dfCO2_uatm
variable.fullName: Sea water fCO2 minus interpolated air fCO2 (μatm)

variable.name: WOCE_QC_FLAG
variable.fullName: Quality control flag for fCO2 values (2=good, 3=questionable)

variable.name: QC_SUBFLAG
variable.fullName: Quality control subflag for fCO2 values, provides explanation when QC flag=3
